intro: Columnea ampliata, commonly known as the broadleaf flame flower, is a striking tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, often climbing or trailing along supports. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a glossy surface and prominent veins. Columnea ampliata thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and well-draining soil for optimal growth.
